description: Removal of Condition 15 (Tree protection) of planning permission ref. 73918/APP/2019/2065 dated 02-09-2019 (Section 73 (Minor Material Amendment) application to vary Condition 2 (Approved Plans) of planning ref: 73918/APP/2019/795 (04-06-19) (Demolition of existing garages and erection of 2 x 2-bedroom and 2 x 3-bedroom dwellinghouses with associated hard and soft landscaping, car parking, refuse storage and amenity space and relocation of existing electricity substation) to add single storey rear extensions to the dwellings), as condition 15 was a duplicate of condition 6 attached to the same permission.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission, reference 73918/APP/2019/2065.
REASON
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans numbers AAL-19-178-P01, AAL-19-178-P02, AAL-19-178-P03,  AAL-19-178-P04,  AAL-19-178-P06 and Arbtech AIA 01 and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two (2020) and the London Plan (2021).

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the following has been completed in accordance with the specified Design and Access Statement. Thereafter the development shall be retained/maintained in accordance with these details for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To ensure that the development complies with the objectives of Policies DMHB11 and DMHB12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two (2020).

The development hereby approved shall implement finished floor levels in accordance with details approved under planning ref: 73918/APP/2019/2218 and shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the approved details.
REASON

To ensure that the development relates satisfactorily to adjoining properties in accordance with To ensure that the development complies with the objectives of Policies DMHB11 and DMHB12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two (2020).

The development hereby approved shall be implemented and subsequently maintained in accordance with the material details approved under planning ref. 3918/APP/2019/2189 on 17-09-19 unless otherwise agreed in writing.
REASON

To ensure that the development presents a satisfactory appearance in accordance with To ensure that the development complies with the objectives of Policies DMHB11 and DMHB12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two (2020).

The development hereby approved shall be implemented and subsequently maintained in accordance with the tree protection details approved under planning ref. 73918/APP/2019/2580 on 26-09-19 unless otherwise agreed in writing.
REASON
To ensure that trees and other vegetation can and will be retained on site and not damaged during construction work and to ensure that the development conforms with Local Plan Policy.

The development hereby approved shall be implemented and subsequently maintained in accordance with the landscaping details approved under planning ref. 73918/APP/2020/7500 on 28-04-20 unless otherwise agreed in writing.
REASON

To ensure that the proposed development will preserve and enhance the visual amenities of the locality and provide adequate facilities in compliance with Policy DMHB14 and DMHB11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two (2020).

The windows facing 65-75 Worcester Road, 50-54 Clammas Way and 2 Clayton Way shall be glazed with permanently obscured glass to at least scale 4 on the Pilkington scale and be non-opening below a height of 1.8 metres taken from internal finished floor level for so long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with policy Policy  DMHB11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two (2020).

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification); no garage(s), shed(s) or other outbuilding(s), nor extension or roof alteration to any dwellinghouse(s) shall be erected without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.
REASON
To protect the character and appearance of the area and amenity of residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DMHB11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two (2020).

The development hereby approved shall be implemented and subsequently maintained in accordance with the sustainable drainage details approved under planning ref. 73918/APP/2020/833 on 16-04-20 unless otherwise agreed in writing.
REASON:
To ensure the development does not increase the risk of flooding in accordance with Policy DMEI9 of the Hillingdon Local Plan -Part Two (2020).

The residential units hereby approved shall be allocated car parking in accordance with the car parking allocation scheme approved under planning ref: 73918/APP/2019/2183. The parking allocation scheme shall remain allocated and dedicated in such a manner for the life-time of the development.
REASON

To ensure that an appropriate level of car parking provision is provided on site in accordance with Policy DMT6 of the Hillingdon Local Plan - Part Two (2020) and Policy T6 of the  London Plan (2021).

The site and dwellings shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Hillingdon Metropolitan Police Crime Prevention Design Adviser (CPDA) on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO). No dwelling shall be occupied until accreditation has been achieved.
REASON

In pursuance of the Council's duty under section 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 to consider crime and disorder implications in excising its planning functions; to promote the well being of the area in pursuance of the Council's powers under section 2 of the Local Government Act 2000, to reflect the guidance contained in the Council's SPG on Community Safety By Design and to ensure the development provides a safe and secure environment in accordance with London Plan (2021).

The development hereby approved shall be implemented and subsequently maintained in accordance with the land contamination details approved under planning ref. 73918/APP/2019/3846 on 23-01-20 including any other reporting required, unless otherwise agreed in writing.
REASON:

To ensure that risks from land contamination to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised, together with those to controlled waters, property and ecological systems and the development can be carried out safely without unacceptable risks to workers, neighbours and other offsite receptors in accordance with the Local Plan.
The dwellings hereby permitted are required to be constructed to meet the standards for a Category 2 M4(2) dwelling, as set out in Approved Document M to the Building Regulations (2010) 2015.
REASON: To ensure that an appropriate standard of housing stock, in accordance with London Plan policy D7 is achieved and maintained.
